item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment: Fast, relatively easy card game with a civilization-building theme which scales effortlessly to many players.
item.wishlistcomment: Out now, getting it as soon as it shows up. 2-7 players, 30 minutes.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders
item.wishlistcomment: July. Adds a new Wonder as well as 4 Leader cards per player.

item.name: À la carte
item.comment: A cooking game with actual metal pans that sit on 3D cardboard stoves. The goal is to get the right amount of each of four ingredients into your dishes, which will require good dexterity and a steady hand.

item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
item.comment: Light family game inspired by the opening of Raiders of the Lost Ark. Push-your-luck treasure collection, and includes a rolling boulder which can crush your characters.

item.name: Agricola
item.comment: Grow crops, raise livestock, and feed your family on a humble single-family farm. There are never enough actions to do what you want and sometimes it is a struggle just to grow enough food to survive.

item.name: Alien Frontiers
item.comment: Roll your 'ships' (dice) and allocate them to gain resources, build more ships, and eventually colonize a planet. Nice maneuvering for territory on an overcrowded world.

item.name: Alien Frontiers: The Mind Control Helmet
Android
item.comment: A detective noir story set in a dystopian future. Android isn't really a murder mystery; rather, the game is about the detectives and their character development, with the murder mystery serving as a convenient framing device. As with any good noir story, each detective has various complications and baggage in their lives, and all five of the characters play very differently and have different things to worry about.

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment: Asymmetric card game, with one player as an amoral megacorporation and the other player as a "runner" attempting to infiltrate his networks to steal and/or trash his data.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: An ancient evil is awakening, and only the harrowed investigators stand between it and the destruction of the world. Long and somewhat complex but phenomenal.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Innsmouth Horror Expansion
item.wishlistcomment: Available. Adds the town of Innsmouth, which is hostile to the investigators but needs to be kept in check to prevent the Deep Ones from rising, along with the usual complement of new investigators, monsters, and such.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Kingsport Horror Expansion
item.wishlistcomment: Available. Adds the town of Kingsport, Rifts, the Epic Battle cards, aquatic monsters, Guardians and additional Heralds, along with the usual new investigators / items / etc.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Miskatonic Horror Expansion
item.wishlistcomment: Available. Adds additional content for each of the other expansions.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The Black Goat of the Woods Expansion
item.wishlistcomment: Available. Mostly just new cards, no major new game elements.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion (Revised Edition)
item.wishlistcomment: Available. Need to make sure it is the 2011 revised version. Adds Exhibit Items and Encounters, Dark Pharaoh herald, patrolled neighborhoods, and Benefit and Detriment cards.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The King in Yellow Expansion
Arkham Horror: The Lurker at the Threshold Expansion
item.wishlistcomment: Available. Add news gate markers with various effects, such as moving gates and punishments for failing to close gates, Relationship cards, and Dark Pacts which allow investigators to more or less sell their souls for enhanced abilities.

item.name: Ascending Empires
item.comment: Fast-paced galactic exploration game which meshes traditional resource management and technology development with a dexterity element, as you flick your spaceships around the galaxy.

item.name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer
item.comment: A deck-building game with an ever-changing set of cards to purchase. Not as deep as Dominion, but much more streamlined and still a lot of fun.

item.name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Control Room Promo
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Deep Drone Promo
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Leprechaun and Pot of Gold Promos
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Nethersnare Promo
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Pathwarden Promo
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – The Rat King Promo
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Vedah, Sage of Swords Promo
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Void Mesmer Promo
Ascension: Return of the Fallen
item.wishlistcomment: June. Standalone two player game or expansion to the base game.

item.name: Ascension: Return of the Fallen – Kythis, the Gatekeeper Promo
Ascension: Storm of Souls – Soul Collector Promo
Aye, Dark Overlord!
item.comment: One player is the Dark Overlord, and the other players are his incompetent minions desperately trying to explain away their failures. A silly, light role-playing game about quick thinking and creative excuses.

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment: Two small armies consisting of humans, dwarves, goblins, giant spiders, and other fantastic creatures battle each other across a variety of battlefields.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: An epic space battle between the remnants of humanity and their progeny, the Cylons. Most of the players are humans, but one or two are secretly Cylons trying to destroy humanity. Fantastic hidden traitor game in which you are constantly accusing everyone else of being the bad guy.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
item.comment: Haunted house game in which one player eventually learns that he is the betrayer, attempting to defeat all of the other players. Not as good as Mansions of Madness, but much shorter and simpler.

item.name: BioShock Infinite: The Siege of Columbia
Black Stories
item.comment: "A woman shares a meal with a man. Some time later, both of them die. What happened?" Players are given a macabre riddle to solve, and can only ask yes/no questions to try to tease out what actually happened. Not really a "game", just riddles to solve, but amazingly fun nonetheless.

item.name: Blades of Legend
item.comment: A Werewolf-style party game in which each of the players has a secret agenda and is trying to eliminate opposing players without being caught.

item.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game
item.comment: Manage a football team consisting of elves, dwarves, or another fantasy race over an entire season. Deckbuilding elements come into play as you draft new star players, adding them into your deck, and there are also permanent upgrades such as merchandising deals. The team with the most fans at the end of the season wins.

item.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game – Sudden Death
Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game
Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: A group of mobsters is trying to divvy up their loot. Everyone is armed and has an itchy trigger finger. Players use foam guns to threaten each other in an attempt to walk away with the most money.

item.name: Cadwallon: City of Thieves
item.comment: Each player controls a band of thieves which infiltrates the city, smashing and grabbing loot. There are different scenarios to change things up, and play tends towards fast and furious.

item.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
item.comment: Investigators, eldritch horrors, and others compete to complete story cards before the other players. In many respects a Cthulhu-themed Magic: The Gathering.

item.name: Castle Panic
item.comment: Defend your castle from a monstrous onslaught. Strictly a children's game, but a fun one.

item.name: Catacombs
item.comment: A dungeon-crawling game in which all of the heroes and monsters are wooden discs. You flick them into each other to do damage, and there are lots of special abilities like the ability to fire arrows (smaller wooden discs) and cast spells like Summon Skeleton (gives you a minion token that functions independently).

item.name: Catacombs: Dark Passageways
item.wishlistcomment: Late May / early June. Micro-expansion with just cards.

item.name: Catacombs: Cavern of Soloth
item.wishlistcomment: Late May / early June. Boxed expansion with 4 new heroes, 4 new villains, new monsters, cards, etc.

item.name: Chaos in the Old World
item.comment: An area control game in which each of the players is an ancient, evil god attempting to ruin the world. The players summon and maneuver monsters in order to dominate as much of the world as possible, and each of the four gods plays very differently and has different means of winning.

item.name: Chaos in the Old World: The Horned Rat Expansion
item.wishlistcomment: June. Adds support for a fifth player, and a completely new alternate set of power cards.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: Card game with a city-building theme. Players choose a character each round, giving them access to different abilities. But you frequently have to guess which roles others have chosen, leading to lots of bluffing and "I know that you know that I know..." sorts of play.

item.name: Clash of Cultures
item.comment: A civilization game with a good balance between combat, culture, and technology. Try to keep your cities happy despite the constant threat of barbarians and your avaricious neighbors, as your civilization advances through the ages.

item.name: Claustrophobia
item.comment: Outstanding asymmetric combat. One player controls at most five heroes, while the other player has a nearly unstoppable flood of demons to throw at him. Games tend to be tense and exciting.

item.name: Claustrophobia: De Profundis
item.wishlistcomment: November. Adds a new type of hero and a new type of enemy monster, as well as more cards, tiles, etc.

item.name: Confusion: Espionage and Deception in the Cold War
item.comment: A chess-like game with a twist: you don't know how any of your pieces move. Each piece has an interchangeable tile which indicates its movement, but these tiles face your opponent. Every time you move a piece, your opponent will tell you whether the move was legal or not, and if it was not, you must move the piece back. You can keep track of your deductions on a dry-erase board, but one of your pieces is actually a double agent, and your opponent can freely allow or disallow any of its moves. Figure out how to best use your pieces, get the briefcase, and get it to the other side of the board before your opponent does.

item.name: Conquest of Planet Earth: The Space Alien Game
item.comment: Each player is an alien race intent on conquering Earth. Players either work together or compete to be first to subjugate the earthlings.

item.name: Core Worlds
item.comment: A deckbuilder in which players colonize planets and use their resources to build up military strength, ultimately colonizing the final "Core Worlds" that are worth a lot of points. The available cards change from round to round as the players travel through the galaxy, and the tableau-building of your military might feels very different from other deckbuilders.

item.name: Core Worlds: Galactic Orders
item.wishlistcomment: NOTE TO SELF: You may not buy this until Core Worlds has five plays. Q4 2012. Adds more ways to cull, more reasons to draft in the initial sectors, more use for the Guilds.

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment: Wildly different alien races vie for control of the galaxy. Lots of bluffing and outguessing your opponents, and the most varied (yet balanced) player powers of any game.

item.name: Cosmic Encounter: Cosmic Alliance
item.wishlistcomment: 1Q 2012. Adds 20 new races, white components, team play.

item.name: Cthulhu Gloom
item.comment: A card game with unique transparent cards that stack to modify underlying cards. Each player controls a family in the Cthulhu mythos, attempting to render his family more miserable than everyone else's.

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment: Players fight for control of Greek islands, making sacrifices to the Greek gods in order to get access to their powers -- Ares to recruit and move soldiers, Poseidon to build and move ships, and so forth. Each god can only be used by one player (the highest bidder) each round, and there are also mythological creatures which can be summoned to attack or interfere with opponents. First player to build (or conquer) two metropolises wins.

item.name: Dark Horse
item.comment: Take control of a unique character in charge of building railroads and cities across the Old West. A dice-based resource management game with a fun theme and tough decisions.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Defenders of the Realm
item.comment: Four generals are advancing towards your capital city, leading huge armies of minions. A small band of heroes must travel across the kingdom, keeping the minions in check while working towards their ultimate goal of defeating all four generals.

item.name: Defenders of the Realm: Hero Expansion #1
Defenders of the Realm: Hero Expansion #2
Defenders of the Realm: Hero Expansion #3
Defenders of the Realm: The Barbarian
Defenders of the Realm: The Dragon Expansion
Defenders of the Realm: The Errant Paladin
Descent: Journeys in the Dark
item.comment: A fantasy dungeon-crawl, similar to Dungeons and Dragons in board game form. Unlike D&D, the Dungeon Master is an actual adversary, doing his best to slaughter the players before they manage to defeat him.
item.wishlistcomment: Available. 2-5 players, 2-4 hours. Playtime becomes more manageable with Road to Legend expansion.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
item.comment: A fantasy dungeon-crawl, similar to Dungeons and Dragons in board game form. Unlike D&D, the Dungeon Master is an actual adversary, doing his best to slaughter the players before they manage to defeat him.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Labyrinth of Ruin
Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Lair of the Wyrm
Descent: The Road to Legend
item.wishlistcomment: Available. Adds campaign play and makes playtime manageable.

item.name: Dixit
item.comment: Each player has a hand of cards featuring different pictures. All of the pictures are beautiful, but bizarre and ambiguous. One player uses a word, phrase, or sentence to describe one of his pictures, with the intent of describing his picture well enough that some people figure out which is the card in question, but not so well that everyone does. It seems strange at first, but players rapidly become better at being suitably ambiguous.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment: The original deckbuilding game. Players start with a very small deck of only 10 weak cards, buying more and more powerful cards to add to their decks during the course of the game. Dominion is still the deepest and most strategic of the deckbuilders, but is also one of the easiest to learn.

item.name: Dominion: Cornucopia
item.wishlistcomment: May / June. Adds cards focused on variety.

item.name: Duel of Ages Set 1: Worldspanner
item.comment: A tactical combat game which pits soldiers from different time periods against one another.

item.name: Dungeon Fighter
item.comment: Adventure through a dungeon, tossing dice onto a target on the table in order to damage monsters. Fighting Medusa? You have to make the throw with your eyes closed. Using a boomerang? Bounce it off the wall before it hits the target. A light, silly, fun game.

item.name: Dungeon Lords
item.comment: You are a dungeon lord, charged with building a deep and dangerous dungeon filled with powerful monsters and deadly traps. You will have to use your monsters and traps to defeat parties of adventurers intent on conquering your dungeon, while juggling the economic realities of dungeon taxes and monster paydays. Very much a eurogame, but a phenomenally fun and strongly-themed one.

item.name: Dungeon Petz
item.comment: The evil dungeon lords in the area need monsters for their lairs, and you are just the pet shop owner to deliver them. Raise fearsome, dangerous (not to mention cute) creatures from hatchlings until they are so powerful that you can barely contain them in their cages, and then sell them to dungeon lords for a tidy profit.
item.wishlistcomment: No release date. 2-4 players, 90 minutes. Pet-raising game set in the Dungeon Lords universe.

item.name: Dungeon Run
item.comment: A group of adventurers venture into a dungeon to defeat its boss and steal its treasure. Sounds familiar... except that this group of adventurers aren't friends. Players will likely have to work together to defeat the boss, but then the first one to grab the summoning stone and get out wins, with everyone else desperately trying to kill him before he can escape.

item.name: Dungeon Twister 2: Prison
item.comment: A chess-like dungeon crawl with rotating board elements.
item.wishlistcomment: Mostly for solo play, I don't know that anyone would ever play this with me.

item.name: DungeonQuest (third edition)
item.comment: You are an adventurer trying to reach the dragon's treasure chamber at the center of the map and escape alive. Uh-oh, it's a swinging blade trap! Roll a 4 or less on 2D6 or die! DungeonQuest is random and incredibly deadly, but can still be fun as long as you don't get too attached to your likely-to-be-doomed adventurer.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
item.comment: Dungeons and Dragons in a quick-playing boardgame form. The major enemies in this game are Count Strahd the vampire and his pet dracolich.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Conquest of Nerath Board Game
item.comment: A D&D-themed "dudes on a map" game in which players vie for control of the world map. Varied special abilities, dungeons, and treasures make this much more than just another version of Risk.
item.wishlistcomment:
NOTE TO SELF: You may not buy this game while you still want to get in more plays of Game of Thrones and Risk: Legacy.
Available.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game
item.comment: Dungeons and Dragons in boardgaming form, set in the world of R.A. Salvatore's Dark Elf and Icewind Dale books.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
item.comment: Dungeons and Dragons in a quick-playing boardgame form. The major enemy in this game is Ashardalon the red dragon.

item.name: Earth Reborn
item.comment: An incredibly deep, modular tactical combat game. Each player controls a squad of troops (either the heroic NORAD or the evil zombie-controlling Salemites) across different scenarios with varying objectives. You might not know your opponent's objective -- which is ok, because you can always capture one of his soldiers and torture him to try to find out.

item.name: Eclipse
item.comment: A game of interstellar exploration and conquest. Players explore the galaxy, colonize planets, manage their economies, develop technology, and design their own custom spacecraft to conquer their opponents.

item.name: Elder Sign
item.comment: A reimagining of Arkham Horror as a dice game. Players complete adventures by rolling certain combinations of dice, receiving rewards such as weapons and spells. Surprisingly deep and fun, it's basically Arkham in half the time and a quarter the table space.

item.name: Eminent Domain
item.comment: A deckbuilding game about conquering and settling planets, with lots of nice technologies to research. Unique and beautiful.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
item.comment: A ten minute long cooperative real-time game in which players are attempting to escape from a collapsing temple. Frantically roll dice to try to collect the symbols you need in order to move on to the next room, collect gems, and break curses. Cursed dice may stop you in your tracks, necessitating a frantic rescue by the other players, because if even one person fails to make it out alive, the entire group loses.

item.name: Factory Fun
item.comment: Connect different machines together in order to create the best factory. Each machine takes one or more inputs and produces an output, and you get bonus points for wiring the output of one machine to the input of another machine. Later rounds rapidly become more difficult, as you have to figure out how to most efficiently pipe the products around your factory.

item.name: Flash Duel: Second Edition
item.comment: Play numbered cards to advance, retreat, and attack opponents. Combat is quick and deadly, with a single unblocked attach resulting in defeat. Twenty different characters provide a good variety of special abilities to use, and there are multiple game modes ranging from a standard two-player duel to a cooperative assault on a dragon boss with a hidden traitor.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
item.comment: Cooperative firefighting game, with the players frantically trying to keep the blaze under control while rescuing civilians trapped in the building.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Urban Structures
Fluxx
item.comment: Easily the worst game I have played, spent the whole time wishing it would just end already.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: Cooperative game about gathering four treasures on a rapidly-sinking island. Players will frantically run around the island trying to control the flooding, before (if they get this far!) making a mad dash for the helicopter at the end of the game. Similar to Pandemic, but faster and easier to learn.

item.name: Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game
item.comment: Inspired by the same pulp adventure comics that inspired the Indiana Jones movies, players travel around the world fighting Nazis and mobsters while hunting for fantastic artifacts. Ancient temples threaten to collapse as the adventurers explore them, and the Nazi zeppelin and various villains dog the adventurers at every step.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: Build a space ship from various components in real time, with everyone grabbing tiles as quickly as they can (with some restrictions, like only being able to use one hand and having to finish placing a tile before grabbing a new one). Then take your ship on a journey which throws various hardships at you to test how well your ship was built. You need to find some amusement in the thought of watching your ship get cut in half by an errant meteor to enjoy this one.
item.wishlistcomment: Reprint expected soon. 2-4 players (5 with the expansion), 1 hour.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: Another Big Expansion
item.wishlistcomment: January 2013. Adds a fourth round, more ship types, more ship components, and (among other hazards) intruders that board your ship and try to eat you.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
item.comment: World domination set in the Game of Thrones universe. Players represent the various major factions vying for control of the continent, and must raise armies and fight for control of the various influence tracks as they attempt to be the first to conquer seven castles or strongholds.

item.name: Gears of War: The Board Game
item.comment: Cooperative tactical combat game in which a squadron of marines face off against alien invaders controlled by the game system. Beautiful components and elegant rules.

item.name: Glory to Rome
item.comment: A card game set in ancient Rome. Each card may act as a resource, a building, a foundation, or a power-boosting patron depending on how it is played. Deeply strategic and unique.

item.name: Grimoire Shuffle
item.comment: A team-based labyrinth battle in the vein of Wiz-War, in which two teams of two or three players traverse a shifting maze to collect spellbooks which they can use on each other.

item.name: Ground Floor
item.comment: A business-themed worker placement game. Hire employees, accumulate money and information, manufacture and sell products, and build new floors which grant your business additional benefits.

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
item.comment: Fantasy combat game with amazing figures and modular terrain.

item.name: High Frontier
item.comment: A complicated game about building rockets to establish factories in space, and then using those factories to build even more sophisticated technology. Fun, but not for the faint of heart.

item.name: Imperial Crusade Armada
item.comment: Interstellar miniatures combat without the miniatures. You command an armada of spaceships, represented by plastic cards that maneuver around the table, and mark off boxes on the cards with a dry-erase marker to indicate current health, shield level, and so forth.

item.name: Infinity Dungeon: Peril without End
item.comment: An RPG-flavored storytelling game. Each player has an identity, such as "Ninja", "Space Marine", or "Panhandler", and attendant set of special powers, equipment, and drawbacks. You will encounter one of a variety of rooms featuring horrible traps, and must describe to the other players how you plan to use your character's abilities to overcome the obstacles. The other players can then challenge you to make your plan even more awesome: "Wait, what this plan really needs is for you to jet-ski ON the shark!"

item.name: Invasion from Outer Space: The Martian Game
item.comment: Same basic ruleset as Last Night on Earth, but Martians vs. carnies. The theme won't appeal to everyone, but the Martians are a much more dynamic threat than the zombies were.

item.name: Isla Dorada
item.comment: All of the players are fighting to move an archaeological expedition around the map in a way that suits their hidden agendas, with no regard for what it does to anyone else's agendas. Fun game with great components and surprisingly tense bidding wars.

item.name: The Isle of Doctor Necreaux
item.comment: Very few meaningful decisions to be made, the game mostly plays itself. Space Hulk: Death Angel is far better as far as coop card games go.

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment: A king of the hill game in which giant monsters duel over control of Tokyo.
item.wishlistcomment: Any day now. 2-6 players, 30 minutes. Looks pretty light, should be good for the kids.

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment: City building game set over five years. Carefully allocate your dice towards different resources so that you can afford to build the buildings you want, but you need to be ready for the monster attack that happens at the end of every year.

item.name: Last Night on Earth 'Advanced Abilities' Supplement
Last Night on Earth 'Radioactive Grave Dead' supplement
Last Night on Earth 'Revenge of the Dead' Supplement
Last Night on Earth 'Zombie Pillage' Supplement
Last Night on Earth: Growing Hunger
Last Night On Earth: Hero Pack One Expansion
item.originalname: Last Night on Earth: Hero Pack 1

item.name: Last Night on Earth: Stock Up
Last Night on Earth: Survival of the Fittest
Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
item.comment: A B-movie about zombies in boardgame form. The heroes get stereotypical movie weapons (up to and including duct taping a shotgun to a chainsaw), while the zombie player can force the heroes to act in stereotypical zombie movie fashion ("Let's split up!", twisted ankles, etc.).

item.name: Last Night on Earth: Zombies with Grave Weapons Miniature Set
Letters from Whitechapel
item.comment: One player is Jack the Ripper, trying to commit murder and escape back to his hideout without getting caught. The other players are the police officers hot on his trail. Tense and beautiful game.
item.wishlistcomment: Out now, getting it as soon as it shows up. 2-6 players, 150 minutes.

item.name: The Looney Bin
item.comment: A "take that" card game in which you are trying to be the first to cure all of your psychiatric patients. Each patient responds to a different combination of treatments, and there are lots of cards to help yourself and screw up your opponents.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
item.comment: A cooperative card game using preconstructed decks. Think Magic: The Gathering, but playing against the game system instead of against each other.
item.wishlistcomment: April. 1-2 players (1-4 with two sets), 1 hour. With how much I enjoy Death Angel and Thunderstone solo, this is probably worth it just for the solo play.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – A Journey to Rhosgobel
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Conflict at the Carrock
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Road to Rivendell
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hills of Emyn Muil
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hunt for Gollum
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Long Dark
Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment: A streamlined Eurogame about putting together adventuring parties to complete quests. Collect fighters, rogues, priests, wizards, and gold, and use them to complete quests. Better buildings provide advanced actions, and intrigue cards allow you to deviously help yourself or attack your opponents.

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
Love Letter
item.comment: A very simple, quick game consisting of only sixteen cards, but with surprising depth and fun.

item.name: Mage Knight Board Game
item.comment: A spectacular and unique game, mixing a fantasy adventure with a well-designed deckbuilding mechanic. Long, but epic in scope, even traveling across the map feels like an adventure.

item.name: Mage Knight Board Game: Krang Character Expansion
Mage Knight Board Game: The Lost Legion
Mage Wars
item.comment: Epic battle between two mages and their summoned familiars, minions, and conjured spells. Mages can create monsters, summon equipment, shoot lightning bolts at each other, reflect said lightning bolts, cast horrible curses, and much more. Plays like a grid-based miniatures game, but with cards instead of miniatures. Unlike similarly-themed games, you do not have a hand of cards; instead your entire spellbook is available to you the entire game, and you may cast any spell at your disposal - once.

item.name: Mage Wars: Conquest of Kumanjaro – Spell Tome Expansion
Mansions of Madness
item.comment: A haunted house game in which one player is the diabolical Mansion Keeper, intent on destroying the minds and bodies of the other players. The harried investigators must search for clues as to the Keeper's overall objective, while fending off monsters and otherworldly happenings. As their injuries mount and sanity slips away, the Keeper can inflict horrible physical and mental trauma on them. Absolutely outstanding game.

item.name: Mansions of Madness: Call of the Wild
Mansions of Madness: Forbidden Alchemy
item.wishlistcomment: December. Adds three new scenarios, new investigators, monsters, etc.

item.name: Mansions of Madness: House of Fears
Mansions of Madness: Season of the Witch
Mansions of Madness: The Silver Tablet
Mansions of Madness: The Yellow Sign
Mansions of Madness: ‘Til Death Do Us Part
Master Plan
item.comment: Light, quick game of mad-scientist themed mayhem. Place cards face down on the table to represent different squares of a diabolical arena, and hop from card to card to try to reach the trophy. You must flip up and resolve any face-down card you jump onto, and cards laid by opponents in your path are not likely to be friendly.

item.name: Merchant of Venus (second edition)
item.comment: Travel between the stars, buying and selling goods and ferrying passengers between different civilizations. As you earn more credits, you can purchase various upgrades for your ship and level up your pilot. Pirates, wormholes, and various other hazards remain a constant threat, so you will need to upgrade your lasers and shields to make traveling the galaxy a safer experience.

item.name: Merchants & Marauders
item.comment: Players can choose to be either merchants, peacefully trading between ports, or pirates preying upon merchants. Surprisingly deep, with quests, satisfying combat, ship upgrades, special power cards, variable player powers, and more, but still elegant and relatively easy to learn.

item.name: Mice and Mystics
item.comment: A cooperative dungeon crawl in which the players are humans transformed into mice. Do battle with centipedes, spiders, and rats as the players attempt to rescue their king from an evil sorceress' clutches. The story is well-integrated into the gameplay, with many scripted story moments and events.

item.name: Moods
item.comment: Players receive a sentence, such as "I feel like I'm going to vomit everywhere", and a mood, such as "romantic". They have to read the sentence in that mood, while the other players guess their mood. Light but surprisingly fun.

item.name: Mystery of the Abbey
item.comment: A deduction game in the same vein as Clue, but for grownups. As in Clue, the hidden suspect card is the murderer, and the suspects in the player's hands are innocent. Players must deduce the monk's identity by questioning each other, and they can ask any question which does not require naming a specific suspect, so for instance "How many bearded monks do you have?" and "Have you ruled out Father Sergio?" are both legal, and even "Where are you headed now?" is valid. Players receive points for determining specific features of the murderer (like "thin" and "bearded"), so it isn't an all-or-nothing win like in Clue.

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment: A board game version of a real-time strategy game. Each player commands an army of strange mutant creatures on a distant planet, mining for resources and using the resources to buy additional creatures. The combat system is simple and elegant, and the gameplay is light enough that a child can understand it while still being very much a gamer's game.
item.wishlistcomment: Out of print. 2-4 players, 90 minutes. Copies occasionally show up for less than $60.

item.name: Nightfall
item.comment: An innovative deckbuilder, only distantly related to Dominion. Players summon monsters and attack each other, trying to end up with the fewest wounds at the end of the game. The card chaining mechanic means you are always involved, even on other people's turns, and makes for interesting decision-making.
item.wishlistcomment: Available. Looks really good, just questioning whether I have room for another deckbuilder.

item.name: Ninjato
item.comment: The players are ninjas, infiltrating clan houses to make off with their treasures. Three different skill paths are available to improve strength, stealth, or versatility, and players must carefully manage their diplomatic relationships with the different clans to score points.

item.name: NOIR: Deductive Mystery Game
item.comment: One player is the killer, attempting to avoid detection while going on a murder spree. The other player is the investigator, attempting to arrest the killer before becoming the next victim. Both killer and investigator reside in a constantly-shifting grid of cards, only able to kill or investigate adjacent cards, and the killer can abandon his identity and disguise himself as someone new when the investigator is getting too close for comfort.

item.name: Nuns on the Run
item.comment: A bunch of novice nuns are out of their chambers after dark, trying to evade the watchful gaze of the Abbess and Prioress. The novices record their movement in secret, while the Abbess and Prioress try to deduce their locations on the map.

item.name: Omen: A Reign of War
item.comment: Greek-mythology-themed game of battling for cities and the favor of gods. Soldiers form the backbone of your army, Oracles attempt to predict the future and give you a variety of benefits, and Beasts form your heavy assault forces. Earn points by completing feats or by plundering cities, and the rewards you earn can be spent for nice benefits or held for an extra point.

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: Four deadly diseases have broken out across the globe, and the players must frantically go from city to city treating the diseases and looking for cures. Pandemic was one of the original co-ops, and the inspiration for Defenders of the Realm and Forbidden Island among others.

item.name: Panic Station
item.comment: A group of space marines board a space station in distress. Unbeknownst to the others, one of the marines was quickly infected by an alien parasite, becoming the Host and trying to spread the infection to his teammates. Every teammate the Host manages to secretly infect joins him in trying to destroy the humans, leaving the humans with no idea whom to trust. Only by collecting sufficient fuel for one of their flamethrowers and burning down the Hive can the humans survive, but it might turn out that the player helpfully gathering your gas cans has been infected all along...

item.name: Panic Station: Survival Kit Mini Expansion
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
Penny Arcade: The Game – Gamers vs. Evil
item.comment: A straightforward deckbuilding game with a Penny Arcade theme. Players who are bothered by Dominion's one-action/one-buy mechanic or Ascension's the-cards-keep-changing tableau may find more to like here.

item.name: Pirate's Cove
item.comment: Players hop from island to island upgrading their ships, and fighting if they end up at the same island at the same time. Lighter than Merchants and Marauders, but still fun and much shorter.

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment: Dexterity game in which players flick wooden discs representing cars around a racetrack.

item.name: Pixel Tactics
item.comment: Position-based tactical card combat, in which two units of up to nine warriors each battle one another for supremacy. Surprisingly deep and replayable.

item.name: Quarriors!
item.comment: Take a deckbuilding game like Dominion, but replace all of the cards with different custom dice, and you have a pretty good idea of how this works. Instead of a deck, each player has a dice bag, making this a fast-paced game with no shuffling.

item.name: Quarriors! Quarmageddon
item.wishlistcomment: June. Six new creatures, two new spells (forty dice)

item.name: Quarriors! Rise of the Demons
item.wishlistcomment: November. Adds Corrupted Quiddity and a new type of monster, as well as one new card for each existing monster.

item.name: Quest: A Time of Heroes
item.comment: Quest: A Time of Heroes is, at its heart, a Choose-Your-Own Adventure book run by a moderator, but with deeper rules and actual tactical combat. Players level up, upgrade their characters, find better equipment, and journey through an overarching campaign consisting of five individual adventures.

item.name: The Red Dragon Inn
item.comment: Card game about fantasy adventurers drinking in an inn. If you pass out drunk or run out of money, you're out, so you need to use all of your powers and magic to make sure you're the last one standing.

item.name: Red November
item.comment: A group of gnomes is trapped aboard a crippled submarine. Players contend with fire, water, hostile creatures, and other hazards as they work together to contain the emergency and escape to safety.

item.name: Resident Evil Deck Building Game
item.comment: Deckbuilding game in the same vein as Dominion, but you are gathering ammo and weapons to take out zombies and other horrible monsters.

item.name: The Resistance
item.comment: A hidden traitor game in which some of the players are members of the resistance and others are spies working to bring them down. The spies know who the other spies are, but the resistance members are desperately trying to figure out who keeps sabotaging their missions.
item.wishlistcomment: Available. 5-10 players, 30 minutes. Hidden traitor deduction game.

item.name: Rex: Final Days of an Empire
item.comment: A remake of the classic game Dune, set in the Twilight Imperium universe. Each player is a different race, with widely varied player powers, who must raise an army and fight for control of the city while trying to avoid the bombardment of the dreadnaught fleet.

item.name: Risk Legacy
item.comment: A reimagining of the classic Risk game which changes over time. Permanent alterations are made to the board during every game, which carry over to affect all future games. New rules and powers permanently come into play when certain conditions occur, drastically altering future plays.

item.name: Road Kill Rally
item.comment: Your car is equipped with flamethrowers and missile launchers, and you get points for killing pedestrians. Fun race game if you don't mind using a card called "Prescription Medications" to more easily run over old people.

item.name: RoadZters
item.comment: A dexterity racing game similar to Pitchcar, but using a sphere with ball bearings inside of it rather than simple wooden discs. Using the sphere, players can curve shots around corners and even stop on inclines.
item.wishlistcomment: Available. 1-4 players, 20 minutes. For the kids, looks better than Pitchcar.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
RoboRally
item.comment: Each player is a robot navigating a death-trap of a factory, filled with conveyor belts, lasers, and bottomless pits. Each turn you will "program" your robot by creating a sequence of five cards (move 2, turn left, back up, etc.) that your robot will follow, but it's a robot -- it will still blindly follow your instructions even if you mess up and turn the wrong way, or if someone bumps into you and pushes you into a square you weren't expecting to be in. Most of the fun comes from these mistakes and the ensuing mayhem.

item.name: Rune Age
item.comment: Fantasy deckbuilding game set in the Descent / Dungeonquest universe in which players attempt to complete scenario-specific objectives. Each of the four factions has unique unit cards which only it can buy, along with a shared set of neutral cards which differ from scenario to scenario.

item.name: Runewars
item.comment: An epic battle in which players gather resources, raise armies, besiege cities, and complete quests. Control the most dragon rules at the end of the game to win.

item.name: Seasons
item.comment: Play across three years of four seasons each, generating the energy of each season and using it to power magical artifacts and powerful familiars. Amazing artwork and surprisingly deep play combine to create a real gem.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse
item.comment: Become a comic-book hero fighting a dangerous supervillian. All players work together as part of a hero team, each with their own unique deck of powers, weapons, and equipment, while the villian and environment decks conspire to destroy the heroes.

item.name: Skyline
item.comment: A simple set-collection game in which you roll dice to create buildings of three different size categories.

item.name: Small World
item.comment: Powers and races are randomly combined to end up with wacky combinations like "Flying Dwarves" and "Swamp Wizards". Each player uses their chosen civilization to conquer parts of the world, but competition for land is fierce. When your civilization has run its course, you can put it In Decline and draw a new one, getting a fresh burst of energy to start conquering again.

item.name: Small World Underground
item.comment: The same basic game as Small World, but with a different selection of races and powers and a few new tricks. The biggest change is the Righteous Relics and Popular Places, which are rewards you get from defeating the monsters that start on the map (similar to the Lost Tribes from the base game), and the new races and powers are fun and creative.

item.name: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Space Alert
item.comment: The players are aboard a space ship in dangerous territory, and must fire lasers, recharge the shields, fuel the reactors, and otherwise push the right buttons at the right time to stay alive. The first phase is real time, during which you have ten minutes to frantically lock in all of your actions during the mission. During the next phase, we reset the board and carefully step through everyone's actions to see what they actually did, not what they think they did.

item.name: Space Cadets
item.comment: You are a starship crewmember, in charge of a station such as weapons or shields. Each station is a different minigame, such as drawing certain shapes out of an opaque bag or laying tiles to maximize your energy. Players must work together despite having different roles in order to defeat the enemy threats.

item.name: Space Hulk (third edition)
item.comment: The Imperium's Space Marines engage the horrific Genestealers in a vicious battle. Essentially "Aliens: The Boardgame", with some of the most beautiful components ever seen in a game.
item.wishlistcomment: Out of print. 2 players, 1 hour. Runs around $120 online.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
item.comment: A fast and deadly combat between space marines and the alien Genestealers. While it is a card game in the literal sense of "you play using cards", the actual gameplay is far more akin to a board game, as you maneuver your marines around their formation and shoot the genestealers they are engaged with.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game – Deathwing Space Marine Pack
Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game – Mission Pack 1
Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game: Space Marine Pack 1
Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game: Tyranid Enemy Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing
item.comment: X-Wing vs. Tie Fighter in a simple, fast, and fluid tactical skirmish game with beautiful minis.

item.name: StarCraft: The Board Game
item.comment: An amazing mix of Ameritrash, Eurogame, and even some deckbuilding thrown in for good measure, Starcraft is an epic game of building up an army and beating your opponents to death with it.

item.name: StarCraft: The Board Game – Brood War Expansion
item.wishlistcomment: Available (but rapidly becoming difficult to find). Adds leadership cards, heroes, scenario play, Defend orders, Medics, Valykeries, Dark Templars, Dark Archons, Corsairs, Lurkers, Devourers, Infested Terrans.

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment: A worker placement game with a Stone Age tribe theme. At first you will struggle to keep your small tribe fed, but by the end of the game will have developed agriculture and better tools, freeing you to harvest the resources you need to build point-scoring huts and technology.

item.name: Stronghold
item.comment: A deeply thematic and replayable strategy game in which one player is the vicious invading monsters and the other is the beleaguered defense manning the castle walls.

item.name: Sucking Vacuum
item.comment: Disaster has befallen the International Space Station, and air is rapidly leaking out! The six astronauts must piece together space suits and get to the escape pod... which only holds two people. Since you want to be one of those two people, grab anything handy and start bludgeoning everyone within reach on your way.

item.name: Summoner Wars
item.comment: Fantasy combat between various factions, such as the fiery Phoenix Elves versus the undead Fallen Kingdom. Units are represented by cards which maneuver on a grid, lending an almost chess-like feel in between the dice and spellcasting. The simple rules, wide variety of factions, and customization options make for a quick, fun fight which feels different every time.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Fallen Kingdom Faction Deck
Summoner Wars: Goodwin's Blade Reinforcement Pack
Summoner Wars: Grungor's Charge Reinforcement Pack
Summoner Wars: Guild Dwarves vs Cave Goblins
Summoner Wars: Hawk's Strike Reinforcement Pack
Summoner Wars: Jungle Elves Faction Deck
Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
Summoner Wars: Piclo's Magic Reinforcement Pack
Summoner Wars: Rukar's Power Reinforcements Pack
Summoner Wars: Taliya's Spirit Reinforcement Pack
Summoner Wars: The Filth Faction Deck
Super Dungeon Explore
item.comment: Inspired by the videogame Gauntlet, one player will control the forces of darkness while the other players try to defeat him. Features monster generators, treasure chests, and potions, and the evil overlord must gain power and advance game modes from 8-bit, through 16-bit and 32-bit.
item.wishlistcomment: No release date. 2-6 players, 90 minutes. Mainly for the kids but looks like fun.

item.name: Super Showdown
item.comment: A simple and highly portable dice game in which the superhero and supervillain attempt to outsmart each other.

item.name: Super Showdown: DISTRESS Kickstarter Exclusive Card
Survive: Escape from Atlantis!
item.comment: Atlantis is sinking and you need to get your people to safety! The waters are incredibly dangerous, full of sharks, whales, giant squid, and sea monsters, and entire boats full of people will end up being swallowed in one gulp. Beautiful components and art and just the right amount of conflict and back-stabbiness make this a great classic game.
item.wishlistcomment: Available. 2-4 players, 1 hour. Should be a solid family game, has an upcoming 5-6 player expansion.

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! 5-6 Player Mini Expansion
Survive: Escape from Atlantis! The Giant Squid Mini Expansion
Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment: Travel the ancient world having exciting adventures and enduring terrible hardships. With a well-written novel-sized book containing 2,600 paragraphs describing what is happening to your character, there is a nearly endless variety of things that can happen to your character, from marrying a rich princess and becoming Sultan to being crippled and turned into a woman. The game is mostly luck, but as long as you can relax and enjoy the ride it's great fun.

item.name: Talisman (fourth edition): The Dragon Expansion
item.wishlistcomment: Fall. Adds a new inner region.

item.name: Talisman (fourth edition): The Sacred Pool Expansion
Talisman (Revised 4th Edition)
item.comment: Play a Sorceress, Chivalric Knight, Dark Cultist, or any of dozens of other characters vying for the Crown of Command at the center of the board. As you travel around the map, places you encounter and monsters you fail to defeat remain on the board, progressively filling in the map and making travel more dangerous. Talisman is random and often brutal, but always epic.

item.name: Tammany Hall
item.comment: A cut-throat battle for political control of New York's immigrant factions. Bribes, negotiation, and backstabbing will all help you secure your base of power.

item.name: Tannhäuser
item.comment: Squad-based combat in an alternate history where World War I (now the Great War) still rages decades later.

item.name: Tempus
item.comment: A civilization game which tracks the development of your civilization from the dawn of history all the way through the discovery of air travel.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment: Card game spanning a civilization's development from ancient times through the modern age.

item.name: Thunderstone
item.comment: A deck-building game similar to Dominion, but instead of buying land for victory points you assemble a party of heroes, equip them with weapons, and send them to the dungeon to battle monsters.

item.name: Thunderstone: Doomgate Legion
item.wishlistcomment: Available. Same size as Wrath of the Elements, adds Treasures and Mercenaries

item.name: Thunderstone: Dragonspire
item.wishlistcomment: Available. Standalone expansion. Adds XP tokens, a Dungeon board, 18 village cards, 11 heroes, and 8 monster sets

item.name: Thunderstone: Thornwood Siege
item.wishlistcomment: June / July. Adds more "active" monsters which can destroy cards in the village and attack players even when they are not visiting the dungeon.

item.name: Tobago
item.comment: The treasure is in the largest forest, within two spaces of a river, but not next to a statue. Go get it! Players play treasure map cards to narrow down the locations of treasures on the island, and then race to be the first to find them.
item.wishlistcomment: Available. 2-4 players, 1 hour. Mostly for the kids, but should be fun for us too.

item.name: A Touch of Evil 'The Allies' Supplement
A Touch of Evil ‘The Madness' Game Supplement
A Touch of Evil: Hero Pack 1
A Touch of Evil: Something Wicked Expansion
A Touch of Evil: The Supernatural Game
item.comment: A villian (such as a werewolf, vampire, or headless horseman) is terrorizing a small town, and the fearless investigators are tasked with hunting him down and defeating him. Similar to Arkham Horror in theme and execution, but shorter and easier to learn.

item.name: Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar
item.comment: A beautiful worker placement game in which the board's large gears advance your workers to better and better positions, if you can only leave them in their positions long enough. You will need to harvest crops, collect resources, and sacrifice crystal skulls to the gods in order to succeed.

item.name: Village
item.comment: Worker placement game in which your villagers eventually grow old and die, only to be replaced by members of the next generation. Manufacture goods, sell to customers, advance your position in the village council or church, or gain fame by traveling. Being among the first in a given profession to die of old age makes you more memorable, earning fame points.

item.name: Warrior Knights
item.comment: Players take on the role of barons vying against each other. You will have to both manage your income as well as recruit and lead an army in combat against the other players. Has some clever mechanics to interleave everyone's actions and trigger game events based on how often certain actions are being performed.

item.name: Wiz-War (eighth edition)
item.comment: Powerful wizards negotiate a magical maze, intent on stealing each other's treasure... or killing the other wizards before they get a chance. A relatively simple, fast-paced game with amazing depth.

item.name: World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game
item.comment: A fantasy adventure game in the same vein as Talisman, but with a World of Warcraft theme. The differences between the different characters are much more pronounced in World of Warcraft, with each character having a unique deck of ability cards.

item.name: Zombicide
item.comment: Large-scale scenario-driven zombie combat. Find new weapons, earn experience, and slaughter hoards of zombies as you struggle to stay alive.
item.conditiontext: Abomination pack, opened and insert discarded but otherwise in mint condition

item.name: Zombie in my Pocket
item.comment: Light tile-drawing semi-cooperative game in which the players explore a zombie-infested house and attempt to dispel the curse.

item.name: Zooloretto
item.comment: A tile laying game with a zoo theme. Try to maneuver animals into the right enclosures and get them to have babies, while interfering with your opponents' attempts to do the same.

item.name: Zpocalypse
item.comment: Everyone you knew and loved is a zombie hungering for your flesh. You're with a group of other survivors, but you don't trust them. Maybe you should wait until they have killed their share of zombies, and then go ahead and finish them off before they can betray you?
